verses.verse: Now the whole <S%H3605><s%> earth <S%H776><s%> used <S%H1961><s%> the same <S%H259><s%> language <S%H8193><s%> and the same <S%H259><s%> words. <S%H1697><s%>

And it came <S%H1961><s%> about as they journeyed <S%H5265><s%> east, <S%H6924><s%> that they found <S%H4672><s%> a plain <S%H1237><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Shinar <S%H8152><s%> and settled <S%H3427><s%> there. <S%H8033><s%>

And they said <S%H559><s%> to one <S%H376><s%> another, <S%H7453><s%> "Come, <S%H3051><s%> let us make <S%H9226><s%> bricks <S%H3835><s%> and burn <S%H8313><s%> [them] thoroughly. <S%H8316><s%>" And they used <S%H1961><s%> brick <S%H3843><s%> for stone, <S%H68><s%> and they used <S%H1961><s%> tar <S%H2564><s%> for mortar. <S%H2563><s%>

And they said, <S%H559><s%> "Come, <S%H3051><s%> let us build <S%H1129><s%> for ourselves a city, <S%H5892><s%> and a tower <S%H4026><s%> whose top <S%H7218><s%> [will reach] into heaven, <S%H8064><s%> and let us make <S%H6213><s%> for ourselves a name; <S%H8034><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> we be scattered <S%H6327><s%> abroad over <S%H5921><s%> the face <S%H6440><s%> of the whole <S%H3605><s%> earth. <S%H776><s%>"

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> came <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to see <S%H7200><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%> and the tower <S%H4026><s%> which <S%H834><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> had built. <S%H1129><s%>

And the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Behold, <S%H2005><s%> they are one <S%H259><s%> people, <S%H5971><s%> and they all <S%H3605><s%> have the same <S%H259><s%> language. <S%H8193><s%> And this <S%H2088><s%> is what they began <S%H2490><s%> to do, <S%H6213><s%> and now <S%H6258><s%> nothing <S%H3808><s%> <S%H3605><s%> which <S%H834><s%> they purpose <S%H2161><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> will be impossible <S%H1219><s%> for them.

"Come, <S%H3051><s%> let Us go <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> and there <S%H8033><s%> confuse <S%H1101><s%> their language, <S%H8193><s%> that they may not understand <S%H8085><s%> one <S%H376><s%> another's speech. <S%H8193><s%>"

So the Lord <S%H3068><s%> scattered <S%H6327><s%> them abroad from there <S%H8033><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> the face <S%H6440><s%> of the whole <S%H3605><s%> earth; <S%H776><s%> and they stopped <S%H2308><s%> building <S%H1129><s%> the city. <S%H5892><s%>

Therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> its name <S%H8034><s%> was called <S%H7121><s%> Babel, <S%H894><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> confused <S%H1101><s%> the language <S%H8193><s%> of the whole <S%H3605><s%> earth; <S%H776><s%> and from there <S%H8033><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> scattered <S%H6327><s%> them abroad over <S%H5921><s%> the face <S%H6440><s%> of the whole <S%H3605><s%> earth. <S%H776><s%>

These <S%H428><s%> are [the records of] the generations <S%H8435><s%> of Shem. <S%H8035><s%> Shem <S%H8035><s%> was one hundred <S%H3967><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old, <S%H1121><s%> and became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Arpachshad <S%H775><s%> two years <S%H8141><s%> after <S%H310><s%> the flood; <S%H3999><s%>

and Shem <S%H8035><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> after <S%H310><s%> he became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Arpachshad, <S%H775><s%> and he had <S%H3205><s%> [other] sons <S%H1121><s%> and daughters. <S%H1323><s%>
And Arpachshad <S%H775><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> thirty-five years, <S%H8141><s%> and became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Shelah; <S%H7974><s%>

and Arpachshad <S%H775><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> four <S%H702><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> and three <S%H7969><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> after <S%H310><s%> he became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Shelah, <S%H7974><s%> and he had <S%H3205><s%> [other] sons <S%H1121><s%> and daughters. <S%H1323><s%>
And Shelah <S%H7974><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> thirty <S%H7970><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> and became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Eber; <S%H5677><s%>

and Shelah <S%H7974><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> four <S%H702><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> and three <S%H7969><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> after <S%H310><s%> he became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Eber, <S%H5677><s%> and he had <S%H3205><s%> [other] sons <S%H1121><s%> and daughters. <S%H1323><s%>
And Eber <S%H5677><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> thirty-four years, <S%H8141><s%> and became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Peleg; <S%H6389><s%>

and Eber <S%H5677><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> four <S%H702><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> and thirty <S%H7970><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> after <S%H310><s%> he became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Peleg, <S%H6389><s%> and he had <S%H3205><s%> [other] sons <S%H1121><s%> and daughters. <S%H1323><s%>
And Peleg <S%H6389><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> thirty <S%H7970><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> and became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Reu; <S%H7466><s%>

and Peleg <S%H6389><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> two hundred <S%H3967><s%> and nine <S%H8672><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> after <S%H310><s%> he became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Reu, <S%H7466><s%> and he had <S%H3205><s%> [other] sons <S%H1121><s%> and daughters. <S%H1323><s%>
And Reu <S%H7466><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> thirty-two years, <S%H8141><s%> and became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Serug; <S%H8286><s%>

and Reu <S%H7466><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> two hundred <S%H3967><s%> and seven <S%H7651><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> after <S%H310><s%> he became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Serug, <S%H8286><s%> and he had <S%H3205><s%> [other] sons <S%H1121><s%> and daughters. <S%H1323><s%>
And Serug <S%H8286><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> thirty <S%H7970><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> and became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Nahor; <S%H5152><s%>

and Serug <S%H8286><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> two hundred <S%H3967><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> after <S%H310><s%> he became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Nahor, <S%H5152><s%> and he had <S%H3205><s%> [other] sons <S%H1121><s%> and daughters. <S%H1323><s%>
And Nahor <S%H5152><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> twenty-nine years, <S%H8141><s%> and became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Terah; <S%H8646><s%>

and Nahor <S%H5152><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> one hundred <S%H3967><s%> and nineteen <S%H8672><s%> <S%H6240><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> after <S%H310><s%> he became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Terah, <S%H8646><s%> and he had <S%H3205><s%> [other] sons <S%H1121><s%> and daughters. <S%H1323><s%>

And Terah <S%H8646><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> seventy <S%H7657><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> and became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Abram, <S%H87><s%> Nahor <S%H5152><s%> and Haran. <S%H2039><s%>

Now these <S%H428><s%> are [the records of] the generations <S%H8435><s%> of Terah. <S%H8646><s%> Terah <S%H8646><s%> became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Abram, <S%H87><s%> Nahor <S%H5152><s%> and Haran; <S%H2039><s%> and Haran <S%H2039><s%> became <S%H3205><s%> the father <S%H3205><s%> of Lot. <S%H3876><s%>

And Haran <S%H2039><s%> died <S%H4191><s%> in the presence <S%H6440><s%> of his father Terah <S%H1><s%> in the land <S%H8646><s%> of his birth, <S%H776><s%> in Ur <S%H4138><s%> of the Chaldeans. <S%H218><s%>

And Abram <S%H87><s%> and Nahor <S%H5152><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> wives <S%H802><s%> for themselves. The name <S%H8034><s%> of Abram's wife <S%H802><s%> was Sarai; <S%H8297><s%> and the name <S%H8034><s%> of Nahor's wife <S%H802><s%> was Milcah, <S%H4435><s%> the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Haran, <S%H2039><s%> the father of Milcah <S%H1><s%> and Iscah. <S%H4435><s%>
And Sarai <S%H8297><s%> was barren; <S%H6135><s%> she had <S%H369><s%> no <S%H369><s%> child. <S%H2056><s%>

And Terah <S%H8646><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> Abram <S%H87><s%> his son, <S%H1121><s%> and Lot <S%H3876><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Haran, <S%H2039><s%> his grandson, <S%H1121><s%> and Sarai <S%H8297><s%> his daughter-in-law, his son <S%H1121><s%> Abram's wife; <S%H802><s%> and they went <S%H3318><s%> out together <S%H854><s%> from Ur <S%H218><s%> of the Chaldeans <S%H3778><s%> in order to enter <S%H1980><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan; <S%H3667><s%> and they went <S%H935><s%> as far <S%H5704><s%> as Haran, <S%H2771><s%> and settled <S%H3427><s%> there. <S%H8033><s%>
And the days <S%H3117><s%> of Terah <S%H8646><s%> were two hundred <S%H3967><s%> and five <S%H2568><s%> years; <S%H8141><s%> and Terah <S%H8646><s%> died <S%H4191><s%> in Haran. <S%H2771><s%>
